website_summaries.verdict: A basic stool with some upgrades – specifically, a wider base that's harder to tip.
pros: Slip-resistant surface on base and step
Measures 15.125 inches wide by 6.5 inches high by 11.125 inches deep
cons: Could use a little more slip resistance on some flooring, but this is easy to add at home

customer_reviews.title: Great for potty training and beyond!
customer_reviews.text: I have been searching for a good stool for my daughter to use for potty training, but I wanted something that wasn't an eyesore and could also be used as a step stool by me (120lbs.) This one is great! The cool grey color is much less jarring than the black or red versions, which I have seen in big box retail stores. The rubberized feet really keep it from slipping, and the top surface area has a nice sticky rubber feel and is larger than most of the kids' step stools on the market. It's also a bit taller than most competitors, which is what I was looking for. We purchased two and are very happy.
customer_reviews.author: APaulsonTop Contributor: Children's Books

customer_reviews.title: worth the extra 5 bucks
customer_reviews.text: If you're like me, and you save EVERY DIME ON EVERY POSSIBLE PURCHASE, you spent an hour researching these little stools. Do I get the bottom model, the cheapest one, or do I get a folding stool that can even withstand adult weight? Folding stands are an absolute no because little fingers can get caught and pinched! So scratch that one off your list. The bottom tier stool doesnt have enough of the rubbery grip like this one does, and the last thing you want is a fall! This one is very secure, have never had a fall, always stays upright, and looks great. I got the super happy magenta color. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Eternal Optimist

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this step stool for my granddaughter when she was just starting to walk. She is now turning 8 and it is still in perfect shape and is still being used to brush teeth, etc in the bathroom. What I like the best is that when you put it down, it doesn't budge. It grips the floor, no matter what the surface is and it is very stable. It's perfectly shaped to fit one foot on each side. Even my son has used it on occasion and he is 250 lbs. Any lastly, it still looks pretty darn good considering that it is used by 2 kids for all these years. SUPER good buy.
customer_reviews.author: lacey

customer_reviews.title: Excellent and safe step stool for toddlers!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered one of these years ago for my kids and recently it fell onto the hard floor and cracked. We ordered the same one to replace it because we like it so much. I like that the rubber base will not slip at all on the bathroom tile and it is a good height. Most of the other stools I looked at were too short.
customer_reviews.author: Lyndsey808

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our son
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our 18 month old son and after a couple weeks it seems this is exactly what we needed. Not sturdy enough for adults, which is fine for us. Is lightweight so my son can easily move around.
customer_reviews.author: angela xhakolli

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and non scratching
customer_reviews.text: This stool is perfect for my 2.5 year old to pick up herself and move wherever she wants in the kitchen to reach things on the counter. The plastic is lightweight and has the grip material on the bottom edges so that it won't slide and won't scratch my hardwood floors, even when she drops it. I highly recommend this stool for kids. It has a weight limit of around 100 lbs, so it's not meant for adults, or it will break. If you found this review helpful, please click on the helpful button below.
customer_reviews.author: Bill in MassachusettsTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: It's Ginormous
customer_reviews.text: This thing is huge. It's decently sturdy and serves its purpose, but it's stinkin' huge. Also, Amazon sent us a black one instead of the grey one, so that's fun. Seriously though, it doesn't move around when my daughter uses it and it holds her weight and much more without any fear of it collapsing, so I call that a win.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... this for my 2yr old so that she can easily reach the bathroom sink
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 2yr old so that she can easily reach the bathroom sink. Arrived on time and in great condition. There was a sticker on top, but that come off easily with no sticky residue left on the step stool. Feels sturdy, although I haven't actually put all my weight on it. It doesn't slide around easily either, there's rubber going around the entire bottom of it. Perfect height for my 2yr old to wash her hands.
customer_reviews.author: Matt & Whitney

customer_reviews.title: Stable and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: This product turned out perfect for my daughter! She graduated to a “big girl” bed but it was a little too high for her so we purchased this step to help her get in and out of bed. The rubber on the bottom keeps it stable and it’s extremely light weight. My daughter has begun to use it around the rest of the house to reach things she couldn’t before and then she simply takes it back to her bedroom.
customer_reviews.author: Karli

customer_reviews.title: Great step stool for children, and good value
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 to help my younger child learn to climb, we have one for the older child for potty training. Best step stool for little kids ever. Its sturdy so they are safe, but easy to move from spot to spot. It doesn't tip over easily on carpet or tile. Even doubles as my footrest when the kids are climbing on everything.
customer_reviews.author: KP

customer_reviews.title: You be surprised !!!
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 children, ages 12,7,5 and 2 . I purchased this item for my 3 youngest to use to help them reach the bathroom sink wash their hands and help them sit on the toilet . To be honest I was surprised I am 5’1 weigh 150 and I been using it to grab things that are not in my reach .. keeps my weight as well . Love it
customer_reviews.author: Sheytoon

customer_reviews.title: Great until it cracked.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this stool for almost 2 years for my son who is now 3. I love that it is lightweight, a nice subtle color, and best of all, NON SLIP. He can pick it up and move it wherever he needs it. I tried several other stools, including the Baby Bjorn, and this one is by far the best for not slipping on our tile and the non-slip top. But somewhere along the line, someone must have used it as a stool who exceeded the 110 lb limit. It is cracked now. I am debating whether to order another one or get a different stool with a higher limit, because inevitably the same thing will probably happen.
customer_reviews.author: JustAnotherShopper

customer_reviews.title: My 3yo son picked it out and it's left
customer_reviews.text: I bought my son a fancy hand painted wood stool with two steps... and replaced it with this. It's perfect for the pedestal sink in our downstairs bathroom. It grips the laminate floor really well, and slides right up against the sink when it's not in use, so we're not constantly bumping into it. It's lightweight and easy to clean too.
customer_reviews.author: MrsK

customer_reviews.title: Got a green stool instead of gray
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I gave it four stars is because I ordered the gray stool to match one that I already had, and I received a teal green stool. I do love the gray stool (which is why I ordered another for our other bathroom). It is SUPER sturdy yet very easy for our toddler to move around on his own. I like the handles and that the base has the grippy silicone to prevent sliding.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Like the safety design for kids
customer_reviews.text: The good thing about this product which is the main reason I chose it was because it has the non-slippery thing on the bottom and on the top of the stool. Even though the height wasn't very ideal for my two and four year old kids, at least it's safe for them to step down the stool on their own. After using it for few months, the top started cracking up but it's still usable. I was struggling a little bit to spend $15 to purchase this but I think it worths it!
customer_reviews.author: Katie L.

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: My 2 yr old loves her stool. She uses it to her lights on and easily moves it around her room to reach toys and what not. It does have a hole on each side to use as handle which was nice because I couldn't see that I the pictures. She it is very stable and the grippy bottom is a great touch. All in all it has been a very used and loved item.
customer_reviews.author: Megs

customer_reviews.title: Sent used stool, charged full price, no disclaimer
customer_reviews.text: What can I say about a stool? It's fine. It gets the job done. It doesn't slide around and it doesn't fold it and pinch any fingers. But this stool has definitely been used. It arrived dirty and scuffed up. I cleaned it and will go ahead and use it as is. But if I was going to buy a used stool, I would expect to pay half price. I'm exasperated at the seller for presenting this as new, and charging full price, when it is obviously a reject from some previously in satisfied customer. Poor form, seller. Not cool.
customer_reviews.author: ladyrach

customer_reviews.title: Not very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised how flimsy this was for being Bumbo brand. I can't stand on it to show my toddler how to use it because I'm sure it will break. I know they wanted it to be lightweight so he can carry it but it could still be sturdier plastic. I do like the wide base so he can't tip it over. The colored parts are all grippy non skid material which is nice as well. Cute colors
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: Great step stool!
customer_reviews.text: This is the most cost-effective one I have found on the market, anywhere! It's lightweight but sturdy with the rubber bottoms and my little one can pick it up and move it if she wants to (Has a hole on each side for easy pick-up) The only thing I wish it had a wider top to where she can stand on it no matter how it is angled. But the horizontal design means she can only step on it and face the way the stool is facing. (sorry if that was confusing) Still, it is the best for the price ($10!) compared to the $20-$30 in stores which is ridiculous! Thank you for this product! I'm considering buying another one!
customer_reviews.author: MommySweetpea

customer_reviews.title: Essential product for potty training
customer_reviews.text: Great product for toddlers who are learning to potty train and wash their hands. It’s sturdy so it doesn’t move once placed down. This stool is critical in our training and I’d definitely purchase again and recommend it for anyone whose exploring this journey.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Very nice but not tall enough for some needs
customer_reviews.text: Of course the height is listed and it is just that - but it is too short to help my 2 yr old get her hands under the water in the sink or to have a foot rest when potty training. I had to buy another taller for that. Otherwise - super cute and easy for her to move.
customer_reviews.author: Reader, Tx

customer_reviews.title: A good buy
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and easy for my son to position to be able to turn on the light and wash his hands in the bathroom. We got it so that he can be more independent during potty training and it fits the bill. It's also a little taller than most of the single step stools I found.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, Light-Weight Stool
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my three year old and it is perfect for washing hands during potty training and helping out in the kitchen. Light enough he can move it easily and it is sturdy. Easy to clean and doesn't slip around on the floor at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent stool!
customer_reviews.text: We love this stool so much we bought a second one. The rubber grips the floor even after bath time at Sea World (I know I can't be the only one with a splashing orca). The base is wide enough so even when you shift your weight to one side it doesn't tip. If I could improve anything, it might be nice to add a second step, but otherwise, I like this a lot!
customer_reviews.author: Caterpillar Girl

customer_reviews.title: Bumbo Makes Good Stuff
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this to help with potty training our son. We had a cheaper stool that we were kicking back and forth from the toilet to the sink. I bought this one to keep in front of the toilet. It's much better than the other stool. The rubber bottoms keep it in place. Plus, there is more room on top for him to stand. And, if he gets it dirty, it's quite easy to wipe down. Bumbo makes good stuff. We still have the original Bumbo seat we bought about six years ago. It's going strong. We're using it with our third child now. I'll continue to buy Bumbo brand products. I've yet to be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Hipturt1015

customer_reviews.title: Slightly wobbly- too short for 36 inch height.
customer_reviews.text: Marked down one star because it can move a bit on tile. Works great for our 2.5 year old. He is 36 inches tall so this stil is a bit short for him to wash his hands and things on his own. Next time I would purchase the two step stool instead, but only because he is short.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Schimke

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: This step stool is perfect for my 6 year old. Now he can get his own cup and bowl and feel more independent. It’s lightweight and has no slip rubber top and bottom so i know it’s not going to slide out from under him.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry

customer_reviews.title: Awful
customer_reviews.text: Not sturdy and definitely made with super cheap plastic. Broke in less than 1 week with 2 year old as only user.
customer_reviews.author: Ryann Lehman

customer_reviews.title: I am very satisfied with this product
customer_reviews.text: Most people buy this for their kids, but I bought this to use around our kitchen. I have high cabinets, so this really helps if you need a step stool to reach things up there. It does have a weight limit of 110 lbs, so be aware if you are buying this for an adult. My mother also uses this as a stool to sit on when organizing the lower shelves in the kitchen. Overall, I am very satisfied with this product. I really like the size of this. It's very sturdy, and the non-slip top works well.
customer_reviews.author: cstar

customer_reviews.title: Great find!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent! I have bought other steping stools for my girls and this is by far the best. Easy to move around, no accidents, all plastic and non slip. Love it! Price is great, the stepping stools on the stores are similar price and not as good as this one.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Ar

customer_reviews.title: Maybe just a little taller would be better
customer_reviews.text: My son is almost 4 and I wish this was a tad taller. He still has to stand on tippy toes to reach the faucet, and we use a faucet extender. Otherwise, I like the simple gray and white color, and the entire bottom has rubber so it doesn’t slip.
customer_reviews.author: Rascal

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: We use this stool for washing the hands of our 22 month old. The rubber bottom grips really well on tile/vinyl floors so it won't slide out from under her. The top is also grippy and large enough in area that we don't worry about her falling off of it. It stores nicely between the toilet and the wall which keeps it out of the way when not in use. Overall, it was exactly what we were looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Okay.
customer_reviews.text: It’s good in that there’s rubber things in the bottom so it’s non slip. But it was too short for my son. He couldn’t reach over the sink with this. I got one with two steps instead that was better.
customer_reviews.author: bb

customer_reviews.title: Great Price and Durable..
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a sturdy stool for my kids to reach the potty and sink and this is perfect. I did not want to pay $20-25 on a stool so the price on this one was a plus too. It does not move when the kids climb on (I have hardwood floors). It does come up really close to my toilet so there is not a really big gap in between. I ended up liking it so much I ordered another one to have downstairs. It does have holes on each side of it so my kids can grab it and move it themselves to where they need it to.
customer_reviews.author: Oliva Toro

customer_reviews.title: Will Not Slip.
customer_reviews.text: With the rubber bottom, this does not slip on our bathroom floors. Sometimes it sticks too much. I have to pick it up, because it does not slide with a foot.
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: Perfect height for our 20 month old!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect height for our 20 month old to wash his hands at our pedestal sink... this in combination with the faucet extender we purchased made my life so much easier (I'm currently pregnant and it was becoming difficult to lift him for hand washing). Definitely recommend this stool! Link to Faucet Extender:
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Safe and durable
customer_reviews.text: Great stool for little ones. Rubber bottom keeps it from slipping and rubber top keeps them from slipping. I clean mine with a Clorox wipe, it’s super easy and only takes a minute. It’d be nice if it came in a few different heights but it still works well for my kids.
customer_reviews.author: Kaylee

customer_reviews.title: Safe & Easy
customer_reviews.text: Great shape for fitting at the base of a toilet. Light weight with handles that make it easy for my 2 year old daughter to move into place when she needs to go. The grip on the floor and top are make for a very secure step. Easy to clean after accidents or in-between. So pleased with the first, we bought a 2nd of these after 6 months of use. Unfortunately, after about 12 months the rubber grip has begun to separate from the base of the stool. For the price and amount of use, still a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Jason M.

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it in the long run
customer_reviews.text: I originally really the style and sturdiness of these, and purchased two. They are light and very easy for my toddler to move, and have a wide, grippy step that prevents slippage when reaching. However, it has been less than half a year of light use and the trim between the 'toes' is loose, and one of the stools has a cracked top. These are not sturdy, and offer no structural bracing underneath which makes them extremely vulnerable to cracking under pressure or pushing from a determined toddler. A traditional wood step will replace these.
customer_reviews.author: M. Podolec

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for what we bought it for
customer_reviews.text: We bought it to potty train our son. He moves it to the toilet to pee then to the sink to rinse his hands. It is light, sturdy and has non slip top and bottom so I don’t have to worry about it shooting out from under him when he is reaching for something
customer_reviews.author: Ramsey

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for toddler
customer_reviews.text: Great for pottying toddler. The rubber on the bottom is excellent for tile floors. It will not slip! Love it so much I bought 2.
customer_reviews.author: My Indiana Farmhouse

customer_reviews.title: Great at first, but broke in time.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this stool almost two years ago and it was WONDERFUL until this week when the top broke under the weight of a 31 pound child. The stool is supposed to hold 100+ pounds. Two years seems like a short life span for something that seems so duraable otherwise, especially for this brand.I have a second Circo stool I bought at Target the same week and it has held up, so clearly this product is inferior to other brands.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: Great stool for toddler
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, pleasing dark pink color (more berry in person), nice quality. Easy for my 2-year-old to maneuver, and I don’t worry that she’s going to slip and fall using it because it’s so sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey A.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent stool. It is lightweight and easy to carry. My 18 month old can even move it around. Plus is does not tip over, even if you stand all the way on one edge. I tried many times just to make sure it was safe. Love, love, love it!
customer_reviews.author: Destry Dispain

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: My kid loves this and can easily carry it around from room to room as needed. The rubber has excellent grip. Love that part of the products go to a good cause!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Kennedy and Todd Matthews

customer_reviews.title: not long lasting gripping
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this for months, but now the rubber has come off and is dangling down on the bottom. The hardwood floors are no longer protected and are scratching when my 2 year old grandson moves the step stool about. It is not as safe to use because the rubber was the gripping material. I stopped using it when I made the discovery. It was never used that much since my grandson is not visiting frequently.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Lamb

customer_reviews.title: Best potty training stool
customer_reviews.text: Best stool we’ve had to date for the potty! My son can move it around on his own and he is very stable standing on it. I like that it’s a little grippy on the floor so it doesn’t shift easily on our tile floor.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Macha

customer_reviews.title: It is a step stool
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent step stool. It is lightweight and there are holes on each side for moving it, rubber on the bottom edge to keep it from sliding, and rubber on the top also. The packaging stated that it has a weight rating of about 110lbs. I haven't stepped on or sat on it - don't need to - but it is a tad shorter than I would have liked. Although it could be a little bit thicker, it is sturdy enough for our toddler and easy to clean. We have been using it for a few weeks now.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Rubber bottom provides safety and will protects the floor too!
customer_reviews.text: Best step stool ever! I bought three, and I'm so glad that I did! I love that the rubber bottom make it secure, so my child is safe on it AND it doesn't scratch my floor!
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: this step stool is perfect for him
customer_reviews.text: My 4-year old grandson was pleasantly surprised when I told him to look in the bathroom. The sink is a little high, and he's had trouble washing his hands and brushing his teeth; this step stool is perfect for him! I think he was going in the bathroom just to wash his hands, he enjoyed it so much! It's sturdy and not too obtrusive. I like that there are holes in the sides, in case it gets upended and water gets in side-- no drowning hazard. I Highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Pati Beardsley

customer_reviews.title: Great little stool for our daughter to reach the sink
customer_reviews.text: Great little stool for our daughter to reach the sink. The bottom rubber is really tacky so it does not slide on tile, wood, or carpet floor. Good product, definitely recommend. *UPDATE* We have no had this stool for almost a year and it is used everyday in the kids bathroom at home for reaching the sink. Holds up great. My 4 year old daughter uses it all over the house as well for reaching anything. She can easily carry it around and plop it down where she needs it.
customer_reviews.author: Ben B

customer_reviews.title: 11" deep at the widest part) it is a good stool. Strong grips on the floor and on ...
customer_reviews.text: Aside from the fact that I read the dimensions wrong and thought that this stool was 11" TALL (oops, 11" deep at the widest part) it is a good stool. Strong grips on the floor and on the top, and lightweight enough for my 33 month old to move it around easily. She loves the colors/appearance too! Sadly for me she prefers this one to a much more expensive ("fashionable") wooden bamboo one I had bought months ago...but whatever gets her to use the potty by herself, I"ll take it!
customer_reviews.author: J. Ribeiro

customer_reviews.title: Great little stool
customer_reviews.text: This is very light weight, easy for my son and my hugely pregnant self to move, and it doesn't slide on our tile floors. He doesn't slip on the top part, or have issues with tipping (unless he's goofing around as he shouldn't be) so I feel that it's very safe. Definitely pleased for the price. Also, my husband and I both have used this to sit on periodically during poo-poo encouragement sessions, and it holds us well without seeming to struggle.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia Brown

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and useful
customer_reviews.text: We liked it and used it so much that we bought a second one and have one on each floor.
customer_reviews.author: tsmom

customer_reviews.title: Great step stool for kid or adults
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy step stool with good grip that doesn't slip, strong enough for adults to use too
customer_reviews.author: NM_shopper

customer_reviews.title: Good no slip stool but beware of weight limit
customer_reviews.text: I like the grip of this stool but the weight limit isn't that high. I would like to use it as well if it's in my kitchen anyway and I can definitely feel it give a little at 130 pounds. It makes me question how long I will be able to use it compared to other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon H. Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Cute design but too small
customer_reviews.text: I love the style but unfortunately this stool is just too small. It's not big enough in length or width so I constantly feel like my toddler is teetering on the edge. I will say however that it hasn't tipped over yet when she's stood on the edge so that's a good sign.
customer_reviews.author: Sophie Lang

customer_reviews.title: A+
customer_reviews.text: light enough for my 2.5 year old to carry around when needed for hand washing or trying to use the potty. Still is a little short for him to reach the sink but at least he already knows how to use it and is comfortable using it. The rubber feet keep in from sliding around on any floor surface which is great. The same rubber is found on the top so the toddlers feet do not slide as well. Overall happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mope

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: Easy to clean, doesn’t slide around because of the runner along the bottom so my child won’t fall when they step up on it.
customer_reviews.author: JLW

customer_reviews.title: We love this step stool
customer_reviews.text: We love this step stool! It is so steady I feel confident when my toddler steps on it, it wont tip or move. I bought to be used at the toilet for potty training (works well there ;)) but I am pleasantly surprised that my toddler now carries it around our home and uses it at she feels she needs it. Its so light weight that she has no prob carrying it around, and secure that I have no prob allowing her to use it without my supervision. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Mama

customer_reviews.title: Its also solidly constructed and easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Bumbo Step Stool that I've purchased. A neighbor gave us a small stool so I didn't think we needed another of these. I was wrong. The biggest strength of this item is the level of stability it affords a small child climbing on it. Unlike the earlier stool, our child doesn't fall off of this. I think he could actually dance on it and it would still stay steady. Its also solidly constructed and easy to clean. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Williams

customer_reviews.title: Great stool
customer_reviews.text: Bought this little stool for a 3 year old to make it easier to brush teeth and wash hands. It's perfect. Wish it was a tiny bit taller but it stays put with the little ones on his toes.
customer_reviews.author: KarenKB

customer_reviews.title: Good find
customer_reviews.text: It's a little bulky and takes up a bit of space but it's cute and my kid loves it. Durable and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: MadhuriKC

customer_reviews.title: Great stool for our toddler!
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old LOVES this stool! While it's not quite tall enough for his feet to reach when on the potty, he still insists on pulling it over to climb on when getting on the potty. We also use it for the sink for him to wash his hands and brush his teeth. The no slip grip bottom is great, and I am fairly certain it would be almost impossible to tip over. He calls it his "cool cow stool" and has become a staple in our home. We will probably buy at least one more for upstairs.
customer_reviews.author: UGA girl

customer_reviews.title: Firm non slip support
customer_reviews.text: Love these step stools. the feet on the bottom are very secure and grip the floor so I have no worries that my little one will fall. The top is also textured rubber for non slip support. The height is awesome (they were one of the taller stools I found). I would definitely recommend this product. I purchased one for the bathroom for my toddlers and one for kitchen so my 8 yr can start helping with dishes.
customer_reviews.author: Momof6

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old loves this step stool. He can move it around easily and it gives him the right admit of boost to do his business
customer_reviews.author: Mamita

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and the right height for the potty
customer_reviews.text: This stool was just the right height for our daughter to use while potty training. It works great and is study. She doesn’t feel uneasy using it. Plus it grips the floor really well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and durable. Great for kids.
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for my kids for getting to the sink to brush their teeth and for stepping onto the big potty. It’s light weight so they can move it themselves and the grip bottom makes it nice and stable.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: Good price for nice step stool
customer_reviews.text: Loved it looks very nice in my restroom I didn’t want anything too bright or noticeable and it’s very light and has grip so it doesn’t move definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: Vane B

customer_reviews.title: Great price for the quality
customer_reviews.text: I love that it doesn't slide around. I can see us having this stool for a while. Definitely good quality. Great price for the quality
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth. Manno

customer_reviews.title: Bumbo Step Stool
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for what I needed. I have arthritis in my knee and hip joints and needed to get my little dog's food and water bowls up off the floor. I already had ceramic bowls for her and wanted to continue to use them, These stools are perfect, perfect size and height, and rubberized top so that the bowls don't slide around at all. Such a help.
customer_reviews.author: joalex1

customer_reviews.title: NON SKID!
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure why this was rated so high but its really a fantastic step for kids. Its ultra lightweight so they can carry it easily between locations. When it place, it does NOT slide or skid as our previous step did. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Agent Smith

customer_reviews.title: This is a good step-stool for little kids
customer_reviews.text: This is a good step-stool for little kids. It's just the right height for my daughter (39 inches tall) to reach the sink or sit on the potty without need for assistance. It wipes clean easily and is very light, so she can carry it around as needed.
customer_reviews.author: squirrelly

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little stool
customer_reviews.text: Love this stool for my son. He is two and can't quite reach the sink to wash his hands and brush his teeth, so I decided to get a stool for him. This one has a rubbery type of surface on the top and bottom that grips well, so you don't have to worry about your little one slipping. It is the perfect height, and also has holes in the sides that work as handles, so he can get it out and put it away himself very easily. Love it
customer_reviews.author: Kelsi

customer_reviews.title: Broken
customer_reviews.text: Our first one we used well for 2 years then broke while my husband was sitting on it. We got a new one anyway because it worked well for a while. It should be fine if you respect the weight limit!
customer_reviews.author: PRTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy step stool
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one getting for my second bathroom, it is great for my potty trained son and my 2 learning to potty train. It’s the perfect height for standard toilets and very sturdy and easy to clean
customer_reviews.author: Eden L Daniels

customer_reviews.title: If your child is 6-years old, this will still be good.
customer_reviews.text: Safe, light and yet strong enough for my 6-year old. Recommending it for anyone who is looking for a good quality combined with a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Yuliia Karaziia

customer_reviews.title: Used for everything from cooking to washing hands
customer_reviews.text: Our toddler uses this all the time for "cooking assistance" and washing hands. Sturdy and still going strong after almost a year of use.
customer_reviews.author: Ionlybuydeals

customer_reviews.title: Soo Cute!
customer_reviews.text: It's adorable and sturdy. I got this for my six year old.
customer_reviews.author: Monique Remas

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Needed a light weight, sturdy stool for my 5 year old to use the bathroom. This works perfect as he can move by himself and it holds him easily.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Harris

customer_reviews.title: Good product. Came used?
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product. It will be enjoy. Unfortunately it came dirty and appears used. I am capable of cleaning it. Just wish I didn’t have too since I paid for a new one. Other than that it’s as expected and works very well
customer_reviews.author: Livlkme

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids but pay attention to the weight limit
customer_reviews.text: Great stool for KIDS but pay attention to the weight limit. I think it is like 110lbs max. I had no clue and I used it while I was about 8 months pregnant and completely split the thing in two!!!!
customer_reviews.author: RobinATL

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: This is our second step stool. We've had one for the kitchen for our toddler and now one for the bathroom to reach the toilet and sink. Super durable. The grips at the bottom to keep it from moving are key.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Great stool!
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy enough for my little one and will hopefully work for years to come! I like the grip it has around the bottom as well so it doesn’t slip on the tile while she is on it.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea G.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, light, and stable
customer_reviews.text: Our 3 1/2 year old uses this for using the toilet and for using the sink. She is able to easily move it by herself. It grips the floor very well when she it climbing onto the toilet (our toilet is ADA, and slightly higher than average, so even with a stool it's still a little high). I'm in the 110-115lb range and I stepped on it and it still felt very sturdy under my weight. Our daughter also seems to really like the design, even though it isn't that fancy.
customer_reviews.author: C. Reyloc

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Perfect hight. Very study and not slippery. My 2yo loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Meskir Kidane

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed...buy the BabyBjorn stool instead.
customer_reviews.text: When it arrived I questioned it's durability. It's very light weight because the plastic is extremely thin. After about 5 months the rubber grip under the stool started falling off. Now we're at 8 months now & I'm worried it will start sliding on the tile since the grip is almost off. Of course it worked at first, but I should have gone w/my instinct to return it and repurchase another BabyBjorn stool for the 2nd bathroom.
customer_reviews.author: Meltx13

customer_reviews.title: Great product and perfect height.
customer_reviews.text: I've been on the hunt for the perfect sized single-step stool and this is perfect! My two year old is not the tallest but this is the right height for him to get up on to the toilet, and he can almost reach the handles on the faucet while standing on it. The gripped feet on the bottom truly keep it from sliding around, and the same material covers the top of the stool making it safe even if it accidentally gets wet. Really happy with this!
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Great basic step stool!
customer_reviews.text: This stool looks very nice in our bathroom as opposed to the colorful cartoony ones sold in the stores. It has good grip on the bottom and top so it is secure will not slide or flip. The only thing keeping me from giving it five stars is that I wish it had a little bit bigger of a surface area for my toddler especially when she is using it to get onto the toilet and needs to turn around on it. The height is perfect though and it is a good quality and value.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, yet light
customer_reviews.text: This is a great step stool for my child! I love that it has a soft, grippy top that helps keep little feet in place. There are also grips on the bottom of the stool to keep it in place on the floor. Feels very sturdy, and is great quality. Super portable and light. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: MrsW

customer_reviews.title: This stool is really sturdy for kids
customer_reviews.text: This was an "18-month Birthday present" for my little explorer who was trying to use anything he could think of as a stool & falling quite a bit. This stool is really sturdy for kids. I wouldn't recommend it for adult use, but my 5-year-old & my toddler (now 2-years-old) use it quite a bit. The hand-holes make it easy for even little guys to move it where they want it to go, and the grips on the bottom keep it steady in one place.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Good grip on bottom
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be a very durable made stepstool for toddlers. It has good grip on the bottom and for the actual stepping spot. My daughters like using it and being able to move it themselves.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great stool, great price!
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice stool at a great price. My 2-yr old daughter is able to move it in front of the sink by herself and the feet keep it firmly in place as she stands on it. She's been using it since she was a little over 18 months. It's stable and neither too tall for her nor too short. She feels comfortable using it every night for brushing her teeth at the sink.
customer_reviews.author: Erin R.

customer_reviews.title: Everything I never knew I needed in a toddler stool
customer_reviews.text: After looking at many different stools, I chose this one because a reviewer pointed out that this stool's base is wider than its top, making it difficult to tip. That reviewer was spot on! My two year-old has been using this stool for 2 months - it's sturdy, hard to slip off of, easy for a toddler to move, and a great price. I don't love the colors, but I love everything else about it!
customer_reviews.author: MichMPS

customer_reviews.title: ... have had this stool for months now and we love it! We use it every day and it ...
customer_reviews.text: We have had this stool for months now and we love it! We use it every day and it has held up well. The rubber on the bottom is great, in fact it is so good it is hard to move the stool- which causes the stool to be extremely LOUD when you are trying to scoot it with your feet. i suppose that I could bend over to pick it upto move it, but when cleaning a bathroom of 3 kids, scooting it with my feet is so much easier!
customer_reviews.author: busymomma29

customer_reviews.title: Granddaughter loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for the grandkids to reach the sink and toilet. Oldest has figured out that if she moves the stool over by the sink, it makes her tall enough to reach the faucet. Sigh... It doesn't slip or slide on the tile floor in the bathroom, and seems to be very sturdy for the kids. I personally haven't used it as a step stool, since I can reach the toilet and sink on my own ;)
customer_reviews.author: mickimause

customer_reviews.title: Looks great after a year of heavy use!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! We've had this step stool for the better part of a year and it's as good as new. It doesn't slip or slide and I love that it has grippies on both bottom and top. I have a very active little one so I really appreciate the added safety. Would definitely recommend -- about to order two more for the other bathrooms in the house!
customer_reviews.author: Elisabeth Delp

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: We were looking for a lightweight stool for our small bathroom. This one is sturdy, doesn't slip, and my toddler can move it on her own as she needs. The height is also just right for what we need - not too short and not too tall.
customer_reviews.author: S. Story

customer_reviews.title: This is a sturdy step stool with no sharp edges on the bottom ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a sturdy step stool with no sharp edges on the bottom so no worries on getting pinched. It is lightweight as well, so easy to move from one place to the other. It looks great and seems to have a non skid bottom so feels like it will not slip if you stand on it. In sum, it has everything that a parent would want from a step stool.
customer_reviews.author: goldfish

customer_reviews.title: Great stool!
customer_reviews.text: Not for an adult to stand on :) but I liked it so much for our son that when I broke it, I bought the same one again.
customer_reviews.author: Corie

product_meta.title: Bumbo Step Stool Black
product_meta.description: Color:BlackA portable, lightweight and sturdy stool designed to help toddlers take those first steps toward independence. The slip-resistant surface on base and step provides a stable place for toddlers to reach the sink or toilet.
feature_bullets: Sturdy, lightweight and portable. Measures(w x h x d): 15.125 x 6.5 x 11.125 inches
Slip-resistant surface on base and step
Great for use for potty training
Slip resistant surface on base and step
Great for use with the Bumbo Toilet Trainer

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars1,685 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
